results.title: Symbolism in literature
results.creator_credit: Sigma Education Films, Herb Schick, Noel Korn and Herman Epstein
results.brief_description: The basic theories of symbolism are discussed as an introduction. Edgar Allen Poe’s chilling story, “The Tell Tale Heart”, helps us to uncover symbols and their meanings, enhancing our enjoyment and understanding of fiction. Also briefly discusses symbolism in Van Gogh’s work. Uses animation to accompany Poe’s story.

results.title: Symbolism and luxury: the new century 1897-1911
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, David Muir and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye”.
The Spirit of the Plains (10min): Painted in 1897, this is one of Sydney Long’s finest pieces of work. Endormies: A painting by Rupert Bunny. The Mother (9min): Examines the range and quality of artist George Lambert’s best work. The Ferry (8min): This painting is the sunniest and most lyrical of E. Phillips Fox’s paintings.

results.title: Symbol formation & acquisition of language
results.creator_credit: George A. Colburn, Darrel Schwandt, GPN and DLGHS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Worlds of childhood”.
A child’s capacity to learn symbols is the first step to acquiring language. Through observations of a deaf family who converse in American sign language, and visits to a family with a child learning to speak, we are shown how language facilitates self-awareness and builds a child’s understanding of the world.

results.title: Symbol boy
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB, Film Australia and Bruce Moir
results.brief_description: A teaching aid made for the film Mr Symbol man. The film animates a system of pictographs created by Charles K. Bliss to help nonverbal people communicate. The film shows how the symbols work by using them to illustrate one day in the life of a mute child. Animation by Les Drew.

results.title: Symbiosis
results.brief_description: There are many examples in nature of dependence amongst orhanisms. This film illustrates some examples of this cooperative dependence. Sea anemone and damsel fish, yucca and yucca moth, lichens, termites and protozoa, and ants and aphids are all examples that give insights into the relationship called symbiosis. Music by David Blumberg.

results.title: Symbiosis
results.creator_credit: Animated Cartoon Studio and Stoian Dukov
results.brief_description: A humorous animated story about a prisoner and a warden who share a desert island. As the warden attends to the needs of his prisoner it becomes increasingly obvious that they are both dependant on each other. At times their roles appear to be reversed posing several questions about who is actually free. Music by Stefan Dimitrov, animated by Dimitar Petkov.

results.title: Sylvie's story
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Gerry Rogers, Kathleen Shannon and Tina Horne
results.brief_description: Sylvie’s Story is part of the series The Next Step, which examines the services needed by and available to battered women. The film recreates the experience of Sylvie, a battered woman who seeks shelter in a Montreal transition house. Faced with the threat of violence, loneliness, the lack of financial resources or information about services, the victim is often understandably reluctant to seek help. The film emphasizes the importance for women of speaking out and sharing their experiences with other women. The film also points out the role of the transition house in putting the battered woman in touch with appropriate legal and social services.

results.title: Sylvia, Fran and Joy
results.brief_description: Three young women voice their feelings about the role of wife-mother-housekeeper. Sylvia shares responsibilities with her husband domestically and as a wage-earner; Fran is in a state of transition having recently left her husband; and Joy is the traditionalist who seemingly accepts her role without question.

results.title: Sylvia Scarlett
results.creator_credit: Pandro S. Berman, RKO Radio Pictures and George Cukor
results.brief_description: Directed by legendary film maker George Cukor, the dazzling talents of Katharine Hepburn and Cary Grant light up the screen in this engaging lovingly filmed comedy adventure. When her father runs afoul of the law in re-war Paris, a plucky young girl (Katharine Hepburn) disguises herself as a boy to aid in their escape. But when they team up with a low-brow con-man (Cary Grant), Kate’s scheming soon precipitates a disastrous series of uproarious romantic misunderstandings.

results.title: Sylvia (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Southern Light Pictures, Cinepro, Unitel, Don Reynolds and Michael Firth
results.brief_description: A dramatisation of the extraordinary life of the revolutionary educator, Sylvia Ashton-Warner and her work with Maori children in the late 1940’s in a remote part of New Zealand. She achieves wondrous results but is more than just a teacher. In a sensitive portrayal, Eleanor David depicts her artistry, nervousness, gift for friendship, cultural isolation and her courage in fighting a boorish collection of educational inspectors. Also starring Nigel Terry, Tom Wilkinson, Mary Regan. Co-starring Martyn Sanderson, Terence Cooper, David Letch and Sarah Pierce. Based on “Teacher” and “I passed this way” by Sylvia Ashton-Warner.
